etymology.description: pictogram: three small marks/dots representing smallness; later the dots elongated; Shuowen misread it as 会意: 八 + 丨.
etymology.interpretation: Three short strokes portray a tiny object or the idea of smallness. As the script evolved, the dots were drawn as short lines, which led to the later but incorrect analysis of 八 plus 丨.

examples.chinese: 这个苹果很小(這個蘋果很小)。
他把字写得太小(他把字寫得太小)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ zì xiě de tài xiǎo.
examples.english: He wrote the characters too small.

examples.chinese: 小问题也要重视(小問題也要重視)。
examples.english: Small problems should also be taken seriously.
